senses.de: A list of names, numbers, or other information arranged in a particular order.
senses.ex: I looked up her name in the telephone directory.

Tips.title: Organizational Tool
Tips.description: Directories often help people quickly find contact details or information.
Tips.example: Have a look at the company directory to get the manager’s extension number.

Tips.title: Physical and Digital
Tips.description: Directories exist both in print, like phone books, and online as databases.
Tips.example: You can use an online business directory to find local services.

Tips.title: Arranged Information
Tips.description: Information in a directory is usually sorted alphabetically or by category.
Tips.example: The tourist directory lists all the hotels by location and then by name.

senses.de: A folder or place where data is stored on a computer
senses.ex: You can find the file in the 'Documents' directory.

Tips.title: File Organization
Tips.description: In computing, directories help organize files in a structured and navigable way.
Tips.example: Save your project in a separate directory on your desktop for easy access.

Tips.title: Hierarchy Levels
Tips.description: Computer directories can have multiple levels, called subdirectories.
Tips.example: I created a subdirectory under 'Music' for each genre.

Tips.title: Path Navigation
Tips.description: Directory paths tell you where to find a file within the folder structure.
Tips.example: Copy the full directory path to ensure you don't get lost in the folders.

Almanac.wordDefinition:
An almanac is a book that usually contains detailed information about various aspects of weather, astronomy, statistics, and events.

Almanacs also include calendars, farming, and plant information. It provides a wide range of general knowledge, while directory provides specific contact details of individuals and organizations, usually arranged alphabetically or categorically.

To summarize, an almanac is for general information needed in a particular field, while a directory is for specific contact details.

Almanacs focus on providing general knowledge and information while directories focus on providing contact details for individuals and organizations.

Catalogue.wordDefinition:
A catalogue is a list of items, often with pictures or descriptions, that are for sale or available to be borrowed from a library.

A catalogue is used to list items for sale or borrowing, while a directory is used to list information about people or places.

Guide.wordDefinition:
A guide is a document or a person who provides information or advice regarding a particular subject or activity. It is commonly used to assist someone in making a decision or finding their way around.

For example, a travel guide provides information on tourist destinations and activities.

A directory is a list of information whereas a guide provides information or advice to assist someone with a specific task or decision.

Handbook.wordDefinition:
A handbook is typically a more comprehensive and detailed guide that provides information about a particular subject.

A handbook may include instructions, rules, and policies, as well as background information and tips.

A directory is more applicable when you need to find contact information for specific individuals or organizations, while a handbook is more applicable when you need a more comprehensive understanding of a particular subject.

For example, a phone book is a directory and would be used to find the phone number of a specific person, while a company's employee handbook would be a comprehensive guide to the company's policies and procedures.

Index.wordDefinition:
An index is a method of organizing and accessing information. An index is used to quickly locate specific information in a book, database, or other organized collection of information.

For instance, if you want to look up a specific word in a dictionary, you can use the index to find the page number for that word.

An index is typically a list of keywords and page numbers that helps you find information quickly.

A directory is a place where files are stored and organized, while an index is a tool used to help users locate specific information within a larger collection of data.

Inventory.wordDefinition:
An inventory is a comprehensive list of all items or resources available, such as an inventory of products in a store or an inventory of equipment in a factory.

In simpler terms, a directory is a list of names or places while an inventory is a list of everything that is available.

Directory is used when referring to specific names or places listed in an organized way, while inventory is used when referring to every item available.

List.wordDefinition:
A directory is like a virtual folder that contains lists of files, subdirectories, and other data.

A list is simply a collection of items arranged in a particular order.

A list can be written down on a piece of paper or displayed on a computer screen.

A directory is a type of list that provides a structured way to organize and access files and folders on a computer or network, while a list is a collection of items that can be used for a variety of purposes.

Directories are used in operating systems, file managers, and network protocols, while lists can be used in everyday life for tasks such as making a grocery list or creating a to-do list.

Register.wordDefinition:
A register is a list of people or things that have been officially recorded or enrolled.

It is used to keep track of people, organizations, or things for administrative or legal purposes. For example, a voter register is a list of people who are eligible to vote in an election.

A directory is used to organize and locate information, while a register is used to keep track of people, organizations, or things for administrative or legal purposes.

Roster.wordDefinition:
A roster is a list of names or groups of people, typically used for organizing schedules or assignments. It is commonly used in sports teams or military groups to assign or record who is participating, when they are playing or working, and what their responsibilities are.

A directory is used to find contact information or resources, while a roster is used to organize schedules or assignments.

quotes.Text: Some writers, I'm told, look for their characters' surnames in telephone directories. I don't - it seems too obvious. Or too deliberate: if you go looking for names, you're bound to find them, of course, but I've always had a superstitious hunch that the names you find by accident are always going to be better and more satisfying somehow.
quotes.Title: British Poet
quotes.Name: Sophie Hannah

quotes.Text: The directories businesses still make nothing but money. They're overleveraged, they're bankrupt entities, but they still are the largest. This is all going to move online over time. Why Citysearch and Service Magic are so important to us, is because nobody has really colonized it yet completely.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Barry Diller

quotes.Text: Not since the steam engine has any invention disrupted business models like the Internet. Whole industries including music distribution, yellow-pages directories, landline telephones, and fax machines have been radically reordered by the digital revolution.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: John Sununu

quotes.Text: I think Facebook is an online directory for colleges... If I want to get information about you, I just go to TheFacebook, type in your name, and it hopefully pulls up all the information I'd care to know about you.

quotes.Name: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.Text: When Facebook first started, and it was just a social directory for undergrads at Harvard, it would have seemed like such a bad startup idea, like some student side project.

quotes.Name: Paul Graham

quotes.Text: There is a directory where you can explore every single person who has gone through YC and a private forum that only founders can participate in.

quotes.Text: WWE Network has been phenomenal for me. It's an amazing directory for not only myself, but for anyone who's into wrestling.

quotes.Text: Recording 'Tusk' was quite absurd. The studio contract rider for refreshments was like a telephone directory.

quotes.Text: An actor who knows his business ought to be able to make the London telephone directory sound enthralling.

quotes.Name: Donald Sinden

quotes.Text: Elizabeth Taylor has more chins than the Chinese telephone directory.

quotes.Name: Joan Rivers
